definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: This article introduces the Data Collecting System in the Multi-function Car for Test and Inspection of Vehicles in Specific Sites and Area.
sentences.chinese: 介绍厂内机动车辆综合检测车的数据检测采集系统。

sentences.english: Police with science and technology in order to achieve effective inhibition of motor vehicles regulations.
sentences.chinese: 为了实现科技强警，有效抑制机动车辆违章。

sentences.english: Such increases were proportionately greater than the growth in population or in the number of registered motor vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 按比例看，该等增长大于人口或登记机动车辆的增长。

sentences.english: We manoeuvred our cars around the Arc and parked in position.
sentences.chinese: 我们周围的弧的机动车辆停放位置和。

sentences.english: The utility model has easy manufacture and low cost, and is applicable to various cars and other motor-vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 制造简便，成本低，各类汽车及其它机动车辆均适用。

sentences.english: Ordinary driving courtesy shall be practiced by all drivers of motor vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 所有的机动车辆驾驶员应懂得常规的驾驶礼貌。

sentences.english: Plunger pumps are single-acting and usually are motor-driven.
sentences.chinese: 柱塞泵是单作用，通常是机动车辆。

sentences.english: Effective use of protective sports and motor vehicle equipment reduces facial injuries.
sentences.chinese: 有效使用安全的运动和机动车辆设备可减少面部损伤。

sentences.english: In urban areas motor vehicles are a major source of PAHs.
sentences.chinese: 在城市地区机动车辆是多环芳烃的主要来源。

sentences.english: Each day thousands of tons of gases come out of the exhausts of motor vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 每天机动车辆的排气管排出成千上万吨废气。

definition: to park (a car etc)/to moor (a boat etc)/to leave sth (in a place)
to go through/to pass through/to be in general use
driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
